intro: Inversodicraea minutiflora subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the eastern dwarf daisy, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often used in rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental appeal. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
